name: 66mm GREAT
description: A 66mm guided really-explosive anti-tank rocket. State-of-the-art optical guidance with advanced pattern-matching heuristics. Other than the guidance system, it's very similar to the LAW rocket.

name: 66mm BFG
description: A 66mm boosted fission grenade rocket with a 10 grams uranium-233 warhead encasing a very tiny deuterium-tritium fusion core booster. State-of-the-art nuclear miniaturization and optical guidance with advanced pattern-matching heuristics. Highly experimental yet safer than hand throwing. When in doubt, always fire it from the farthest possible distance.
//: Total warhead mass: 800g. Blast energy: 94.8 tons.

name: 66mm GWP
description: A 66mm guided white phosphorus rocket. State-of-the-art optical guidance with advanced pattern-matching heuristics. You really don't want to be inside its blast radius. The maximum range of 12 gauge 00 shot is the recommended minimum range for this according to the LGW manual.
